00041 /**
00042  *  Convert
00043  * @brief Utility functions to convert between different types.
00044  */
00045 class Convert {
00046   
00047  public:
00048   
00049   /** 
00050    * Make an int from a c string or die trying.
00051    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00052    * 
00053    * @return - Integer representation of num
00054    */
00055   static int toInt(const std::string& num);
00056 
00057   /** 
00058    * Make an int from a c string.
00059    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00060    * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00061    *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00062    * @return - Integer representation of num
00063    */
00064   static int toIntCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success);
00065 
00066   /** 
00067    * Make an unsigned int from a c string or die trying.
00068    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00069    * 
00070    * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num
00071    */
00072   static unsigned int toUnsignedInt(const std::string& num);
00073 
00074   /** 
00075    * Make an unsigned int from a c string.
00076    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00077    * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00078    *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00079    * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num, 0 if success == false
00080    */
00081   static unsigned int toUnsignedIntCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success);
00082 
00083   /** 
00084    * Make an unsigned int from a c string or die trying.
00085    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00086    * 
00087    * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num
00088    */
00089   static uint64_t toUnsignedInt64(const std::string& num);
00090   static int64_t toInt64(const std::string& num);
00091 
00092   /** 
00093    * Make an unsigned int from a c string.
00094    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00095    * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00096    *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00097    * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num, 0 if success == false
00098    */
00099   static uint64_t toUnsignedInt64Check(const std::string& num, bool *success);
00100   static int64_t toInt64Check(const std::string& num, bool *success);

00102   /** 
00103    * Make an float from a c string.
00104    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00105    * 
00106    * @return - Float representation of num
00107    */
00108   static float toFloat(const std::string& num);

00110   /** 
00111    * Make an float from a c string.

00122    * 
00123    * @return - Double representation of num

00125   static double toDouble(const std::string& num);

00132    * @return - Double representation of num

00134   static double toDoubleCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success);
00135 
00136   /** 
00137    * Make an bool from a c string.
00138    * @param flag - c string representation of number to be parsed. 
00139    *   allowed value are 'true' && 'false'
00140    * 
00141    * @return - Bool representation of flag
00142    */
00143   static bool toBool(const std::string& flag);
00144 
00145   /** 
00146    * Make an bool from a c string.
00147    * @param flag - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00148    *   allowed value are 'true' && 'false'
00149    * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00150    *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00151    * @return - Bool representation of flag, false on failure.
00152    */
00153   static bool toBoolCheck(const std::string& flag, bool *success);

00156   /** 
00157    * Make a string from an integer.
00158    * @param i - integer to be converted.
00159    * 
00160    * @return - String version of int i;
00161    */
00162   static std::string toString(int i);
00163   static std::string toString(size_t i);
00164 
00165   /** 
00166    * Make a string from an double
00167    * @param d - double to be converted.
00168    * 
00169    * @return - String version of int i;
00170    */
00171   static std::string toString(double d);
00172 
00173   /** 
00174    * Test to make sure that two doubles are pretty similar.
00175    * @param d1 
00176    * @param d2 
00177    * @param digits - number of decimal places to examine.
00178    * @return true if doubles are same to digits decimal places.
00179    */
00180   static bool doubleCloseEnough(double d1, double d2, int digits=6);
00181 
00182   /** 
00183    * Make a low precision float from a normal one. Used originally to
00184    * mimic truncation seen in cel files.
00185    * @param f float to be truncated.
00186    * @return truncated float
00187    */
00188   static float floatLowPrecision(float f);
00189 
00190   /**
00191    * Utility function to cut a delimited string into a vector of ints.
00192    *
00193    * @param s - delimited string.
00194    * @param delim - delimiter to chop on.
00195    * @param vec - vector to be filled in.
00196    */
00197   static void strToIntVec(const std::string &s,char delim,std::vector<int> &vec);
00198 
00199   /**
00200    * Utility function to cut a delimited string into a vector of doubles.
00201    *
00202    * @param s - delimited string.
00203    * @param delim - delimiter to chop on.
00204    * @param vec - vector to be filled in.
00205    */
00206   static void strToDoubleVec(const std::string& s, const char delim, std::vector<double>& vec);
00207 
00208   /**
00209    * Utility function to cut a delimited string into a vector of strings.
00210    *
00211    * @param s - delimited string.
00212    * @param delim - delimiter to chop on.
00213    * @param vec - vector to be filled in.
00214    */
00215   static void strToStrVec(const std::string& s, const char delim, std::vector<std::string>& vec);
00216 
00217   /**
00218    * The inverse of strToIntVec
00219    *
00220    * @param inputVector - the vector to convert
00221    * @param delim - delimiter to use
00222    * @return - the resulting string
00223    */
00224   static std::string intVecToString(const std::vector<int> &inputVector, const std::string &delim);
00225 
00226   /**
00227    * The inverse of strToDoubleVec
00228    *
00229    * @param inputVector - the vector to convert
00230    * @param delim - delimiter to use
00231    * @return - the resulting string
00232    */
00233   static std::string doubleVecToString(const std::vector<double> &inputVector, const std::string &delim);
00234 
00235   /**
00236    * Same as intVecToString but using string vectors
00237    *
00238    * @param inputVector - the vector to convert
00239    * @param delim - delimiter to use
00240    * @return - the resulting string
00241    */
00242   static std::string strVecToString(const std::vector<std::string> &inputVector, const std::string &delim);
00243 };
00244 
00245 /** Little template function to make string conversion easy. 
00246     this isn't the fastest way to do things, but it is easy. */
00247 template <class T> 
00248 std::string ToStr(const T &t) {
00249   std::ostringstream s;
00250   s.setf(std::ios_base::boolalpha);
00251   s << t;
00252   return s.str();
00253 }
00254 
00255 /// @brief     Convert the arg to a string.
00256 /// @param     arg     which is a string already.
00257 /// @return    a string
00258 /// @remark    Since it is a string already, no conversion needs to be done.
00259 ///            ToStr returns a new string, so we match that.
00260 // template <> 
00261 inline std::string ToStr(const std::string& str) {
00262   std::string newstr=str;
00263   return newstr;
00264 }
00265 
00266 inline std::string ToStr(double t) {
00267   return Convert::toString(t);
00268 }
00269 
00270 inline std::string ToStr(float t) {
00271   return Convert::toString(static_cast<double>(t));
00272 }

00274 #endif /* _UTIL_CONVERT_H_ */
